title: Vue Fundamentals
description: Test your understanding of the Vue.js framework fundamentals

questions.question: What is the correct syntax for data binding in Vue templates?
questions.explanation: The `{{ message }}` syntax is used for data binding in Vue templates.

questions.question: Which directive is used to conditionally render an element in Vue?
questions.explanation: The `v-if` directive is used to conditionally render an element in Vue.

questions.question: Which of the following are Vue 3 composition API features?
questions.explanation: The `ref()`, `reactive()`, and `computed()` are composition API features in Vue 3.

questions.question: Which directive is used for two-way binding in Vue?
questions.explanation: The `v-model` directive is used for two-way binding in Vue.

questions.question: What does the `setup()` function in Vue 3 do?
options: Initializes reactive state and composition functions
Mounts the component to the DOM
questions.explanation: The `setup()` function in Vue 3 initializes reactive state and composition functions.

questions.question: Which lifecycle hooks are available in the Vue 3 Composition API?
questions.explanation: The `onMounted`, `onUpdated`, and `onUnmounted` are lifecycle hooks in the Vue 3 Composition API.

questions.question: Which directive is used to loop over items in Vue templates?
questions.explanation: The `v-for` directive is used to loop over items in Vue templates.

questions.question: What is the role of `emit` in Vue components?
questions.explanation: The `emit` is used to trigger parent component events in Vue components.
